newsitem.title: USA: Orlando Intl Airport August cargo off 6.8 percent.
newsitem.headline: Orlando Intl Airport August cargo off 6.8 percent.

text.p: Despite recent downturns, cargo volumes at Orlando International Airport (OIA) should improve soon, an airport official said on Tuesday.
Total cargo at OIA in August was 18,918 tons, down 6.8 pct from the same month a year earlier, according to statistics recently released by the Greater Orlando Aviation Authority.
"You should see an upturn in the numbers for late September and October," said Ken St. Armand, OIA's cargo marketing manager.
St. Armand blamed the downturn on the fact that some of the passenger carriers serving the airport switched to narrow-body aircraft, which have less cargo capacity.
Domestic cargo totaled 16,574 tons in August, down 4.99 pct from the year ago and international cargo totaled 2,345 tons, down 17.86 pct from the year earlier, statistics showed.
TransBrasil Airlines on Oct. 27 will add four flights a week to the five it now flies out of Orlando, which should bolster cargo volumes, St. Armand said.
